jobTitle: REMOTE Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner
industry: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education
description:
Seasoned Recruitment is currently seeking a REMOTE Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) to join our team. As a Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner, you will be responsible for providing patient care and medication management. This includes conducting initial consultations for depression and anxiety, as well as follow-up visits for the titration of medications and monitoring of patient progress. You will work closely with Social Workers, Counselors, and Therapists to guide clients after their initial evaluations, and there will also be Psychiatrists on staff who can provide care for patients requiring a higher level of treatment. We are looking for Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioners who possess strong verbal and written communication skills, empathetic and intuitive listening abilities, excellent relationship-building skills, and well-structured thought processes. The ability to work remotely and a commitment of at least 2 hours per week are required. Both full-time and part-time opportunities are available.

Requirements

Requirements: - Valid license as a Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) - DEA license - Excellent verbal and written communication skills - Empathetic and intuitive listening abilities - Strong relationship-building skills - Well-structured thought processes

Benefits

We offer competitive compensation along with flexible working hours that allow you to maintain work-life balance while providing critical mental health support remotely.

Payment Is Guaranteed For Last-minute Cancellations And No-shows.

Join us in creating positive change by making mental health accessible for all individuals through remote psychiatric care.

Apply today and embark on this fulfilling journey with us.
benefits: We offer competitive compensation along with flexible working hours that allow you to maintain work-life balance while providing critical mental health support remotely.
